extends java.lang.Object
implements ContactManager, java.io.Serializable

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int addFutureMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts, java.util.Calendar date)
      Add a new meeting to be held in the future.
      void addMeetingNotes(int id, java.lang.String text)
      The implementation of this method assumes that a meeting which was added as a future meeting but is now in the past can only be converted to a past meeting with this method being called Implementation also assumes that where a past meeting was already added, this method can be used to update its notes,and the notes will be appended to anything previously in place in the field
      void addNewContact(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String notes)
      Contact deemed unique based on ID only, as duplicate name and/or notes are possible
      void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts, java.util.Calendar date, java.lang.String text)
      This method adds a brand new meeting which was not on record previously but took place in the past The method implementation assumes that some notes need to be specified in the constructor as the meeting is created, even if empty
      void flush()
      Writes the contents of the contact manager collections to a file
      java.util.Set<Contact> getAllContacts() 
      java.util.List<Meeting> getAllMeetings() 
      java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(int... ids)
      Returns a list containing the contacts that correspond to the IDs.
      java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a list with the contacts whose name contains that string.
      FutureMeeting getFutureMeeting(int id)
      Returns the FUTURE meeting with the requested ID, or null if there is none.
      java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(java.util.Calendar date)
      This method retrieves meetings that occurred on a given date and returns them in a list Meetings are chronologically sorted by time A tree set structure is used to eliminate duplicates and allow sorting
      java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
      This method retrieves meetings that a contact attended and returns them in a list Meetings are chronologically sorted by dat and time A tree set structure is used to eliminate duplicates and allow sorting
      Meeting getMeeting(int id)
      Returns the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.

      Returns the PAST meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.

      void setAllMeetings(java.util.List<Meeting> allMeetings)

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
        This method retrieves meetings that a contact attended and returns them in a list Meetings are chronologically sorted by dat and time A tree set structure is used to eliminate duplicates and allow sorting

        Returns:

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(java.util.Calendar date)
        This method retrieves meetings that occurred on a given date and returns them in a list Meetings are chronologically sorted by time A tree set structure is used to eliminate duplicates and allow sorting
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        date - the date
        Returns:

      • getPastMeetingList

        public java.util.List<PastMeeting> getPastMeetingList(Contact contact)
        Description copied from interface: ContactManager
        Returns the list of past meetings in which this contact has participated. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.
        Specified by:
        getPastMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the userâ€™s contacts
        Returns:
        the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).

      • addNewPastMeeting

        public void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                     java.util.Calendar date,
                     java.lang.String text)
        This method adds a brand new meeting which was not on record previously but took place in the past The method implementation assumes that some notes need to be specified in the constructor as the meeting is created, even if empty
        Specified by:
        addNewPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of participants
        date - the date on which the meeting took place
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.

      • addMeetingNotes

        public void addMeetingNotes(int id,
                   java.lang.String text)
        The implementation of this method assumes that a meeting which was added as a future meeting but is now in the past can only be converted to a past meeting with this method being called Implementation also assumes that where a past meeting was already added, this method can be used to update its notes,and the notes will be appended to anything previously in place in the field
        Specified by:
        addMeetingNotes in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the meeting
        text - notes to be added about the meeting.

      • addNewContact

        public void addNewContact(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String notes)
        Contact deemed unique based on ID only, as duplicate name and/or notes are possible
        Specified by:
        addNewContact in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the contact.
        notes - notes to be added about the contact.
